review: Absolutely the best doctor I’ve ever had! Goes the extra mile time after time.
Highly recommend! Smart and caring. Staff is great.

Dr. Guest has seen me for the past few years. His kind and knowledgeable manner gave me the assurance I needed upon meeting him. The attention and care, over time, confirmed my feelings. There is a sincere concern for his patients.

Dr. Guest is a wonderful cardiologist! His gentle friendliness and nature immediately put me in a relaxed state of mind in the midst of a condition that was frightening. He listens to me and takes the time to explain diagnoses and procedures. Dr. Guest is interested in me as a person, taking the time to talk about what's going on in my life but not wasting time. I always ask a lot of questions, and Dr. Guest is patient in answering them; I never feel like he's trying to get me out of the office either. For a good, knowledgeable, personable cardiologist, you can't do better than Dr. Guest!

The patient's well-being is of utmost importance to Dr Guest. He is very professional and has excellent inter-personal skills in making you feel confident and comfortable. He does not rush the appointment and takes time in knowing who you are. He is up to date on the latest medications and discusses each of the applicable medications in an understandable manner. His staff reflects his professionalism, promptness and caring. I have full confidence in putting my life in his hands.

Dr. Guest is awesome! I had some chest pains last fall and saw him for a checkup! I had several tests-one in his office! He is the nicest man! He notices little things-like the book I wads reading each time! At my second visit, he asked what I was reading and said I'd been reading an interesting book previously! He's for healthy eating and vitamins which not all doctors are. At my first appointment. I had to wait 49 miinutes before being. His staff is equally nice. I'd highly recommend him!
Dr. Guest is fabulous. Came into the ER late at night to see my husband who was having a heart attack I truly believe that Dr. Guest my husbands life that night.
I had a heart catheterization and stent last month. Followed up with Dr. Guest today. Everything went very well. Dr. Guest seems very knowledgable and thorough. He is a very caring doctor.

I was referred to Dr. Guest by a neighbor after having had heart issues & procedures done elsewhere and still not feeling right. Don't take his initial serious demeanor or straight forwardness wrongly - as he truly cares about his patients and his profession. He is extremely knowledgeable, thoughtful, caring, listens to your concerns and more than most doctors - takes his time with you. Dr. Guest also believes in looking at the bigger picture and your health overall. I can honestly say that after my first visit with him, there was a sense that he knew exactly what was wrong & what had been missed previously, but was professional enough not to make any conclusions till he was able to further examine me himself - and he was right. He is part of a great team, his nurse, PA and staff in the clinic also exhibit the same traits, are responsive when you call in - and make you feel at home remembering you by name. Highly recommend him and would not go elsewhere - he truly cares about you.

Dr. Guest is fantastic! Always caring and very knowledgeable. PERSONALLY calls with test results! Had a very positive experience during heart catheterization - 2 stents placed. Now during office visits spends time focusing on nutrition and exercise - lost 42 lbs and feel great. Could not recommend ANY doctor more highly. I've also referred my husband and he's doing great too!
excellent doctor. Takes a lot of time to understand your problem.
Very good experience at this practice and with this doctor!
I really liked him. Did a thorough history and exam. Explained his thought process well. He eventually solved my issue and I'm grateful.
This is an excellent doctor. Also has a very helpful office staff.

He saw me for the first time several years after a massive heart attack, permanent damage, and open heart surgery. Forced me to have tests that other cardiologists said to never have because of the danger. After several tests and many $ he came in to the post appointment and said "Did you know you have a weak heart?" Never, never, never...
He is RUDE, arrogant, and Unhelpful , he did NOT even do proper Physical exam.
Thorough and smart. I also liked his office and staff.
Best Cardiologist in Atlanta in my opinion. I would recommend him highly.
He is a very persistent doctor. He figured out what my racing heartbeats were when 2 other doctors said nothing was wrong. Great guy.

LB Nov 2016
My visit was scheduled due to the results of a heart scan. My PCP had me scared to death. Dr. Champney was very reassuring, thorough, and offered options. Most importantly, she LISTENED as well as offered medically sound advice. I constantly tell others about her professionalism along with her incredible bedside manner.

Fantastic doctor! She spent an hour with my husband, a patient of herpartner's, after my husband had an incident. Dr. Champney even scheduled a needed procedure for my husband to enable our family to take a long anticipated family vacation.
Very personable, knowledgeable and caring. She takes time to talk with me and understand my concerns, then works with me toward a care plan. She is a person AND a doctor! I like that.

Dr Champney it the most thorough physician i have ever met. she is gracious, very relaxed and pleasant and will spend all the time needed. I never feel rushed and am so very thankful she is my cardiologist. She quite literally saved my life the first time we met.. from her office to the hospital. Thank God for Dr. Champney being so thorough and so concerned. More doctors should pattern their concerns for their patients the way Dr. Champney does.
DR Kimberley Champney was very professional,very knowledgeable in heart care..i am a patient of hers,and will see her again,very soon. HIGHLY RECOMMEND HER to all heart patients...You will love her

I was very impressed with Dr. Champney and all her staff. She was very thorough in making a diagnosis. She takes the time to listen to you and explain her findings in great detail. Excellent communication from her as well as her staff with all of my test results. A wonderful doctor with a very friendly and professional staff, which I have found to be very rare today. I would highly recommend her if you are seeking great cardiac care.

Very pleased with Dr. Champney, Front desk person is a little "off-putting" but everyone else you deal with there is top notch. Dr. Champney will err on the side of PROTECTING you versus being overly concerned about insurance coverage and payment therefrom. I never started out to be her patient but am eternally grateful that her partner was out of the office the day of my appointment and she covered for him. She's been my cardiologist since, and will continue to be.
Highly recommend, If you have a heart problem, Get her as your doctor.
Dr. Arnold is a knowledgeable and caring physician who is always available to help. I've been in his care for over a decade and highly recommend him.
Wonderful. Love him. Excellent cardiologist--very knowledgeable and friendly (unusual these days, you know).

Dr. Arnold saved my life. I have been seeing him since 2001. He always runs a little late but that's okay because takes the time to listen. I drive over 60 miles to see him and it's worth the time. He is a great Doctor and a wonderful person.

If you believe this but I look forward to my visits with Dr. Arnold. I had a massive heart attack and cardiac arrest. I could not ask for a better doctor or nurse. I would highly recommend Dr. Arnold.

Since my triple bypass surgery in April '06 I have felt I was in very competent hands and that Dr Arnold and his associates have given me what I consider outstanding care and I look forward to my future medical care with Dr. Arnold.
Thank you doc for your help. Nobody can ask for a more important matter than the heart. We very much appreciate you.

Had 100% blocked LDA for 7 hours before getting to CL/Emory in Dec. 2005. As bad as they get. Dr. Palmer stayed OT past his shift for me. Was supposed to just cath me for bypass but ER gave me too much blood thinner. He unblocked the artery with the catheter + saved my life.
First visit was good. I go back soon for a stress test.
He was of no help at all...after driving 13 hours I saw phycian assistants....not competent or help full lost my faith in emory...

The reason for my rating..... I called in two prescriptions on Sunday to my pharmacy (authorization needed). The following Friday,(five days later) I was advised by my pharmacy to call the physician's office that they had made several attempts with no response. My physician's nurse stated I could not get a refill without an appt. I made the appt and still no prescription. The nurse was rude and was more interested in controlling the conversation, stating the rules instead of resolving my issue. I have not had two prescriptions for five days. My blood pressure will shoot up quickly to around 220 over 130 without my meds. At this time, I have an appt in two months as advised by my "caring" nurse and no meds called in...This is the reason for my rating.

I saw Dr P. several times. I did not think he cared about me, as a new patient,he did not or could not answer my questions. I hoped he would talk more on the next 2 visits, he did not. Maybe he did not like me. I am a 61 yr old woman in need of a well rated & caring Cardiologist who can do more than smile.

I have been a patient of Dr. Spencer Palmer for over 5 years and have found he is the most professional, competent, dedicated and caring physician I have ever worked with. He always knows the details of my case, which he manages extremely well. During the years of his care, I have learned to trust his expertise, judgment and medical skills without question. His bedside manner could be taught as a medical class. I am proud to be one of his patients.
Excellent cardiologist.... knowledgable and caring staff. We highly recommend this cardiologist.
He's a good one...He put for stents in for me 3 years ago and they work great. He is a person who takes a deep interest in his patients progress.I woulod highly recommend him
Dr. Palmer is the BEST!! I would refer him in a second. He takes time with you and shows an interest in you. He has helped me to loose weight and get into a program for exercise.

Dr. Palmer actually surprised me with his attentiveness and concern! I always expect an abundance of arrogance when I see a specialist, but he seemed interested and listened to what I had to say. He was very caring. I never met a doctor like him! I would highly recommend him to anyone.
Dr Kauten repaired my husbands heart valve. We found him to be very caring and knowledgeable. My husband said after the surgery he felt like he had a new heart.

Had a quintuple bypass performed by Dr. Kauten on 5/6/16 and I am up and around 6 weeks later. Simply the best. Shout out to his PA Phil, the ICU team, the nurses and everyone else involved with my care. You were all the best. Thank you.

After monitoring a heart murmur for a number of years I elected to have Dr. James R. Kauten, MD perform a heart valve replacement. I entered the hospital as an otherwise healthy 58 year old male. In the recovery room after surgery I began to bleed. Dr. Kauten had to reopened my chest to stop the bleeding. After receiving many units of blood, I was sent back to recovery. During the operation my AV node was seriously damaged. For the rest of my life I am totally dependent on a pace maker for survival. I would not recommend Dr. James R. Kauten, MD to a friend.

Dr. Kauten is incredible. I required open heart surgery and my emergency room doctor sent me to Dr. Kauten. God was looking out for me. He is a kind, reassuring GENIUS! Might lack just a little in bedside manner, seems kind of shy actually, but he is a great doctor. My surgery was two years ago and I had six bypasses and an ICD implanted later by another doctor. If you have a broken heart, this is the man you want taking care of you. And his staff is also excellent. My wife and I were in love with them, and all Piedmont personnel, during my two weeks there. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
This dr did my aortic heart valve replacement on 8-15 -11 .He did a great job,I am very blessed to have found him and am doing great I would recommend him in a"heart beat"!!
Great doctor!!! He saved my brother's life. Thanks Doc.

Dr. Kauten seemed very caring and knowledgeable but his partner, Dr. Louis Prevosti, was the doctor that did the bypass on my father. Not just sour grapes that he passed away after Dr. Prevosti did his work but the fact that he told us AFTERWARDS that the surgery would have been difficult for a man half my dad's age. How interesting he couldn't have told us this before the surgery. The story changes after the surgery. No, they can't know everything ahead of time, but don't give tell the family he has a 95% chance if he has more like a 5% chance. Have the decency to be honest. You should be ashamed, Dr. Prevosti. Be glad the rest of the doctors on your team are not like you.
I used to work for him. He is the best in the group (Peachtree Cardiovascular) in my opinion. He is a brilliant surgeon, and a very kind, patient man.
Top notch doctor and a terrific human being as well.
He has been saving my life for over twenty years. He is an outstanding physician.

Dr. Knapp is my 3rd cardiologist since having an experience with congestive heart failure about 8 months ago. The first I felt was not communicating with my gastrointestinal team that was involved in my case. The second was really great but was too difficult to reach. Dr. Knapp and his team at Piedmont is the perfect blend of the rating categories. He cares about his patients and is a very straight talker/explainer. If you can't understand what he tells you then you might be the problem.
Wonderful doctor. Very sensitive to patient's concerns and ailment. Top notch!
Highly excellent doctor with the knowledge and skill to take care of heart patients.

i've been with this practice for many years (previously with Dr. Margolis, also wonderful!). Dr. Gonzalez is professional, kind, reassuring, calm and compassionate. I am rather 'nervous' at any doctor, and she truly has the ability to put me at ease. She is very patient with my nervousness and is thoughtful and thorough in addressing my questions and concerns. I highly recommend her.
She is very thorough and has a bedside manner that is beyond kind and compassionate. She is the kind of doctor you want when you're scared because you have to go to a cardiologist.

Dr Gonzalez did some tests on me, and personally called me back with the results, and talked with with me for about 6 minutes taking time and answering all my questions. She is courteous, thorough and professional. She told me to check back in a year. She doesnt do unecessary tests. She was reassuring, and not "all about the money". I recommend her highly
Gordon is a great doctor. Kind, considerate and very knowlegable.

Back in April, 2000, I went to the emergency room at St Joseph’s one morning about 7AM after having suffered through several episodes of chest pain during the night. They started a nitroglycerine drip and asked if I had a cardiologist, I said no, and they called Dr. Gordon Azar who came right away He immediately saw that I had a septal infarct and he sent me straight to the cath lab-wasting no time. He did a cardiac catherization, which was totally painless, and he placed a stent in my coronary artery. It is still there and working twelve years later, keeping that artery open, and blood flowing to my heart muscle. Dr Azar “saved my heart”. (so the nurses all said) and I could tell he was an exceptional Doctor. Some years later my cousin had the same problem, and I told him to immediately call Dr. Azar, he did, and Dr. Azar also saved his life. If you have chest pains or heart issues, definitely call Dr. Azar; He will take great care of you! God bless Dr. Azar.
I have been seeing Dr. Azar for over 30 years and he always spends the time that is needed, no matter how long it takes. He is sincerely concerned with his patients' well being.
My family has been a patient of Dr Wilmer for nearly 10 years. He is a life saver!

I have been a patient for over 20 years. I highly respect Dr. Wilmer and his staff. Because of his specialty, I sometimes have to wait but that is o.k. because someone needs him more at the time. I highly recommend Dr. Wilmer to anyone needing a cardiologist.

Dr. Wilmer has always been warm, patient and compassionate. He would rather err on the side of safety and that's why he schedules tests instead of guessing the problem. Dr. Wilmer knew my insurance would change this year so he squeezed in my treadmill test before the end of the year, during the Holiday period, just to help me. He always takes the time to explain the situation and procedure, no matter how busy he is and never makes me feel rushed. He is extremely knowledgeable and he cares for his patients. If he's ever late for an appt, it's due to a hospitalized or critically ill patient.

Made me feel like I was a research subject rather than a person. Although he did seem fairly knowledgeable, his bedside manner was severely wanting as he seemed aloof, condescending and negative. His mid-level staff matched him in coldness. The only positive experience was my interaction with the front desk staff who were warm and personable.
Wonderful doctor! Took the time to explain my procedure in detail. One of the most caring physicians I have ever met. He really changed my life for the better.

Dr. Patel quickly diagnosed my problem which for years I was told were panic attacks. He recommended catheter ablation and I have been cured ever since. His office staff were pleasant and efficient. His nurse was top notch. Thanks, Dr. Patel!
Pleasant to talk to and took the time to explain everything in detail. Seemed confident and trustworthy. I highly recommend him.
This man was the most insulting jerk of a doctor I have met. I won't go back despite the excellent staff and the reputation of the practice.
Dr.Sacks goes above and beyond the call of duty. He is a teriffic doctor who totally cares.
Harvey has been my cardiologist since Catherine Andrews referred me to him several years ago. He is caring, thorough, listens. I have complete trust in his judgement.EvHarrell@Comcast.net
Superb doctor with an excellent partner, Dr. Kimberly Champney, patients can see when Dr. Padove is not available. My husband has received unbelievably great care from this practice!

He is a great Cardiologist. He tried to save my son but he could'nt. I think he was more hurt that my son died then I was. My son thanked him for trying to help him. Dr. Padove stated that I went in to tell Jamaal the bad news and he ended up consoling me. That is the way my child was. He did not want you to feel sorry for him. Dr. Padove is a very good Doctor because he took care of my only child. I am very greatful for him. I had my son for 23 good years. Seven of them was sick years but we made it.
Insisted I needed a pacemaker when all he needed to do was take me off the blood pressure meds he had prescribed.’ Terrible doctor.
Great credit to his profession wish all doctors could take classes from him
Excellent Office environment and the staff are great. Dr. Torres is very skilled and current on procedures. Straight forward with his communications. Saved my life!
Great human being, very kind, and very knowledgeable.

If you want a cardiologist who actually connects with you, Dr. Chang is perfect! He is not a pill-pusher and will encourage you to change your life-style to reverse unhealthy habits. He spends quality time with you asking you questions about any recent changes that makes your life more difficult or that indicates problems. He's compassionate and considerate taking time to answer all your questions with explanations in common English (not medical terms that discourage further discussion).
As I was leaving, an elderly couple were so excited to see him that they hugged him like a son. I fully understand why. I have never had a doctor who treated me like a member of his family and I feel like he's a member of my family. Devoted to him and friends who also have him as their cardiologist feel the same way.
Dr. Chang is an outstanding cardiologist, knowledgeable, caring and extremely professional. I have been seeing him fir fourteen years and I would recommend him with no reservations.

Possibly the best doctor in the Emory system. He saved my live when others said there was no hope. He has a bedside manner that is matter of fact and easy going. He gets to the point, finds the problem, and goes to work on it. His staff is without compare and they all love him.
great bedside manner, very impressed. Dr Langberg saved my husband's life! Thank You!
Dr Babaliaros is a bless to any person. He is number one. God bless him
This doctor is a very good doctor and cares for the patient. I give him the highest recommendation possible.

My family and I have been patients of Dr. Brown for over 20 years. He has saved the lives of 3 of my nearest and dearest in that period of time. He is the very best example of a compassionate,brilliant physician, always on the cutting edge. With his easy going demeanor,he inspires confidence and comfort. In this very large, busy practice, one always feels the staff is there for the benefit of the patient. Rare qualities, indeed.
After checking into nearly every possible resource in the city (friends, church, nurses, etc.), Dr. Charlie Brown was recommended as the best in Atlanta.
great bedside manners. took the time to figure out what was wrong. doesn't order a bunch of tests at once, which I liked. great hospital system too.

Dr Balk is very intelligent but had NO concept of patient concerns. During my heart cath I was unsedated and in much distress. He argued with the hospital staff openly and was very arigant. Not concerned with patient interests only concerned with his scheduled.

he was friendly, and communicative and instilled a great degree of confidence that he would do his best to find out what was wrong. I liked the fact he asked if I had any other questions before he left the room.
Dr. Kopelman has been a life saver! Literally! I am so pleased to be in his care. The extent of his knowledge is a blessing!

Doctor Kopleman is an extremely kowledgeable, caring and compassionate doctor. He took incredible care of my son and I feel we owe his life to him. The only reason I rated him 4 on punctuality was because we sometimes would have to wait 15 to 30 minutes to see him. He stayed with us as long as we needed to talk with him (we never felt rushed) and I'm sure he gave all of his patients this same kind of care therefore, of course, he would be late.

Dr.Kopelman and his staff were referred to me nearly 6 yrs ago. He came highly recommended by someone who had just undergone a valve replacement. As for me, I had been misdiagnosed by another doctor and doctor Kopelman got me on the right track. He was very personable, caring and attentive. He made me feel like I was his only patient.
Superb EP cardiologist! I have used this doctor since 2000 and have had two AICD defibrillator implants. Knowledgable, great bedside manner,very caring amd professional. Highly recommend.
Several of my friend and family members have also gone to him. A great doctor and a fine American.
A very caring and knowledgable physician. Highly recommend.
Doctor takes every opportunity to maximize profit and minimize his exposure to risk at the expense of his patients' needs.

Dr. Douglass is very knowledgeable and thorough. I really appreciate his humble disposition. As well as his patience with explaining information and procedures. He truly made me and my family fell comfortable and helped to ease our doubts and fears..
Very knowledgeable and goes out of his way to ensure the well being of his patients.
The best with a GREAT staff. Saved my life twice (so far!)

WHEN I HAD MY HEART ATTACK HE WAS ALWAYS CHECKING ON ME WHEN I WENT HOME AND IF I DID NOT ANSWER THE PHONE AFTER HE CALLED 2 OR 3 TIMES IN 10 MINUTES HE WOULD SEND THE PARAMEDICS WHICH IN SEVERAL CASES THEY ARRIVED IN TIME TO SAVE MY LIFE. THE DOCTOR'S CARING SAVED MY LIFE 3 TIMES. TO THIS DAY HE STILL IS SEEING ME WHEN I HAVE BEEN IN THE HOSPITAL FOR OTHER OPERATIONS. I FIND HIS CONCERN ADMIRBLE AND COMFORTING. HE IS THE BEST HEART SPECIALIST THAT I HAVE BEEN TO OVER THE YEARS.

I should preface my rating by stating the fact that I am disabled. I sought the medical services of Dr. Wilson twice. During the interim period between the first and second medical appointments, I was prescribed a medication that was eventually declared unsafe by the FDA, due to possible adverse heart abnormalities and side effects. This medication was NOT prescribed by Dr. Wilson. The first medical appointment, with Dr. Wilson, was routine and ordinary. However, the second medical appointment was not routine and ordinary. During the second office viist, a battery of tests were performed to determine if there were heart abnormalities. After the tests, Dr. Wilson talked with me one-on-one. His general demeanor and tone could be described as, "I'm busy and I don't have time to talk to you." After I asked him one or two short follow-up questions, he walked right out of the office. Apparently my disability made him very uncomfortable. However, he wasn't uncomfortable taking my money.

I have been a patient with Dr. Gandy for over 10 yrs and he is very knowledgeable and at each visit he gives me detailed instructions on how to keep my health issues under control. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. They even have a fruit out at each visit.

I had my first visit with Dr Gandy today. Great experience,attentive staff members and a family like environment. My brother-in-law encouraged me to see Dr Gandy after experiencing shortness of breath exercising. I had planned to take the entire day off, but my visit with Dr gave me such relief that I went to anyway. PS , free parking. Unheard of!!

An IN-Network doctor is SUPPOSED to send your lab work to IN-network lab facilities... It is expected, and it's part of their job, to manage this. Gandy's staff has been very delinquent in spotting this issue, and calling me back to fix it... consequently, I have a lab company trying to collect hundreds of dollars from me because of this, and the Dr's staff never returns my calls and ignores me. ... so go ahead, waist your time and money, with a Dr. office that is NOT on top of their game

I like the doctor in general, BUT the staff still is having problems resolving billing conflicts with Atherotech diagnostics... plus the staff, and the office manager are have not been returning my calls. Also, I NEVER got the results of my last visit ! I am not going back until they can get their billing issues under control, I don't care what their excuses are for their "new" system !
Dr. T is a brilliant doctor. He isn't always on time but that is probably because he takes the time needed with each and every patient.

Doctor Taranto's staff is lacking of customer service.I call on March 17 at 9:15 AM to speek to the nurse, I got her voice mail I steel wating for her to call me back.I take medicine for high blood presure and depresion and my call was about my medicine.

Dr. Taranto is cardiologist to me, my husband and my Mom and Dad. At first I was taken aback by his brisk, business-like demeanor. His bedside manner improves the longer you know him. He is an excellent doctor and usually runs a few minutes late but his office is run efficiently. We are all pleased!
Dr. Taranto is both a cardiologist and an internist. He is very knowledgeable, thorough and to the point. I have used him for the last 18 years and he is great
He has a very good bed-side manner and is very informative. He is also very compassionate.

He was my Dad's doctor and he is wonderful. Went over and above what is expected to take care of my Dad. My Dad was taken be ambulance to St. Lukes but Dr. Pandya practices at UT Medical University. Dr. Pandya came to St. Lukes on his own time to help with my Dad and visited several times and went over is condition with us even though he didn't need to do that.

Dr. J. H. Smith is very knowledgeable and professional. He was very thorough in his examination and analyzing the issue. He uses excellent techniques in ensuring I, the patient, felt at ease, knew what to expect as it relates to tests and treatment and explained the results in a fashion that I could understand. He is a great cardiologist, I highly recommend his medical services.

Good listening skills. Very thorough with his exams. Takes time to listen and I never feel rushed. Answers my questions in ways that I can understand. May not give a good first impression but his personality is better than you might first think.

This physician is totally full of himself. Smart, and capable, but a JERK! I also found that it was a double-standard that he talked to me about my weight, but he's clearly had a few too many Big Mac's himself. I won't be back.

Good staff. Typical Dr. attitude, which usually
accompanies a high drgee of compentancy...will know on next visit.
extremely sarcastic. rude and very unprofessional. inappropriate behavior.
A little abrasive, but very good. I'd rather have a DR. who knows what he's doing than one who's nice.
No manners.

This doctor and his entire staff are very unprofessional. They refer to each patient by first name. The doctor is very sarcastic in his comments and try to make you feel small. I felt like he verbally attack me because of my health condition. I will never go to him again.

Failed to diagnose my POTS and called me a faker; condition confirmed at Mayo Clinic and Cleveland Clinic but Dr. L. had not a clue, nor did she make any effort to help me control BP over 200/120. Arrogant.

Dr. Lundberg is well-credentialed, but I changed to another cardiologist. Dr. L never explained my condition or treatment options in a way that made sense to me. Follow-up was always with her PA, who confused me more. They aggressively pushed meds that give me intolerable side-effects or I wasn't convinced I needed; did not take my input seriously; seemed irritated I wasn't doing what they told me to do. New dr. put lab results, family history, lifestyle in a way that makes sense & is respectful

The best! Attentive, thorough and respectful. Appointments include in the neighborhood of 20 to 30 minutes with a patient, enough time to clarify and discuss issues and options without feeling rushed. Notice I said DISCUSS, this means your feelings and opinions matter and are taken into account. Her dedication does impact punctuality, but one cannot fault her for this because it is more often than not a result of attending to her more critical hospital patients, and the office staff ALWAYS notifies you in time if she is running late. As they say on eBay A++++.

If there was ever a world class doctor this is it. He is not only medically considered at the very top of his field, he is loved by patients and staff alike. Its clear when he walks the halls at Emory he is respected by everyone there and that is some pretty good company.
She is the best. Compassionate, caring and sharp. Best doctor I have and sha has saved my life several times

I found Dr. Chen to be very pleasant and reassuring during my cath procedure. He worked gently and efficiently and talked to me during the procedure telling me what to expect and what he saw. I would definately go back to him and highly recommend him to others.
Very helpful, knowledgeable and good bed-side manner.
A Doctors Doctor. Excellent staff; up to date on latest procedures. Saved my life from prior mis-diagnosis.
This dr is very knowledgeable,efficient and capable he did my cauterization and is my follow up cardiologist after having had heart valve surgery. I am very blessed to have found him!

Dr. Ang came into our lives out of necessity. I was searching for a new cardiologist for my mother who was having much difficulty in another hospital. This wonderful physician put together a great team of doctors who worked so well communicating with each other that mom survived 3 cardiac arrests. Dr. Ang knew exactly when to back off and allow the lung doctors to do their job first, then had an infectious disease physician step in to clear her of any infection before he had mom's internal pace maker put in. In my book, this physician is tops in giving my mother the greatest opportunity to bounce back from such a scare when other physicians gave up.

Dr.Nadimi is very experienced, educated and knowledgeable. He does not "talk above you" He talks and explains all of your questions until you are satisfied that you understand. He has a great "bedside manner". He treats you as person and takes his time with you. You are not just a number or a paycheck, he cares deeply. He is a VERY GOOD doctor. I highly recommend him for you or any of your loved ones.
Very caring and helpful. He is the Best. Hope He comes back soon.
Always real no drama has a great staff has in office devises so don't have to go to other medical places
This man is a physician's physician. All the rest pale in comparison
Great surgeon! He is a great listener and very skilled doctor. His staff is very good too.
Dr Cook diagnosed me with mitral valve failure on my first visit and got me into a hospital room as soon as possible. I highly recommend him! GG

He has been an outstanding Cardiologist and has helped my husband on several occasions. r. Hershey and the staff are always courteous, punctual, caring in addition to his knowledge as a Cardiologist. We would highly recommend him to anyone needing cardiac care.

I have been a patient of Dr Sigman for years, since his days as a professor at Emory University. As you can see I have nothing but good things to say about him. When I first saw him he found an issue that had been causing me problems for years but had been missed by several other cardiologists simply because he thought outside of the usual box. He is knowledgeable and considerate. He has a superb "bedside manner", will discuss matters openly and clearly, and then makes sure that you, the patient, are fully involved in your treatment.
On top of that, he is simply a nice person

I have been a patient of Dr. Backer for over 3 years and find him to be an excellent doctor. Both Dr. Backer and his staff are friendly and efficient. Dr. Backer has a great bedside manner and spends as much time as needed to make you comfortable and to answer your questions. He is very professional and knowledgeable. Once I read an article which created some concerns for me about a medication I am taking. I left a message with a staff member as to my concerns and several days went by and I had not received a response. I thought possibly the staff member didn’t give him my message. When Dr. Backer did call me back I could see why it took him some time to respond to me. He had done a through research of the subject matter and was able to completely satisfy my concerns. I feel completely satisfied intrusting my cardiovascular medical care with Dr. Backer.

this physician is really not good at al.l. his staff seem to have been trained to be rude and not helpful, particularly his spouse who works in his office or has worked there. i would not advise anyone to go to this physician
Doctor had no bedside manner nor after the surgery no bedside manners about him or his staff. Main concern is not the patient but the dollars they can get from you.
Very knowledgable, good bed side manner, takes his time, answered all my questions. I like this doctor very much.
knowledge, friendly. good bedside manner, ethical, high standards, was at Emory, now at Piedmont
Has been a year and a half and still in pain 24/7
THE BEST
The best cardiologist in Georgia
just the best. able to help more than most doctors

Dr. Corrigan is a wonderful doctor. He makes sure to fully discuss any issues and options and explains why or why not some things can or cannot be done or work in different ways. He has a good, confident bedside manner and definitely takes his patients' health seriously and personally. He's willing to work with the patient to provide the best care while also laying things on the line when it's merited. Wait time depends on location (he works at two) and time of appointment, but he definitely spends time with you to make sure you have full buy-in to his findings and suggestions.
The worst physician. He has no bed side manner and is very arrogant. If you want a physician to be concerned about your healthcare, find someone else.

Dr Priester doesn't respond to messages or email. He gave me a referral to a specialist three months ago, but he messed it up so that Kaiser has the wrong referral in their system. I've repeatedly called over the past three months, even going so far as to find all of the contact information for the specialists and their procedures, so that I could list *exactly* what I need him to do in both an email and a telephone message. I haven't heard from him yet.
Very knowledgeable. Cautious and thorough before suggesting more invasive measures for medical issues.

Believe that Dr. Robinson is really a good doctor. Smart, stays abreast in her field however there seems to be a repeated practice of firm in over booking patients. Your on time arrival standard waiting room time is oft times in excess of 1.5 hours, in addition to when you're called back to the examination room you wait another hour or even longer.

Dr. Blincoe is extremely knowledgeable and helpful. He keeps up-to-date with advances in his field, and is friendly and LISTENS to his patients. I have many questions, as I read a lot on my own, and he is always willing to listen to my comments and concerns. Very professional. No complaints - I recommend him highly.
Dr Battey had to testify and said he would have cleared my mother for elective plastic surgery that took over six hours and she died from complications from the surgery.

Dr Battey had to testify in court and said that he would have cleared my mother for a six hour elective plastic surgery that she died from and that the medical examiner said she was not a candidate for.I would think twice before entrusting my life with him....
Competent, personable and caring.

He and Demetris went in both groins to open a blockage. Afterwards he told us he would only be able to get up to 70% of the blockage. He recommended a doctor from Seattle Washington do this procedure on me. He said he was going to be down on the 10th to help them on their 10 worst patients. He said he could get it around 90% opening. He said the doctor from Seattle would go in one groin and they would go in the other groin and/or my arm. I said OK. On the 10th after 4 hours in me. Demetris came to my room and told us they could not get to the blockage. They recommended I go to Washington and let Lombardi do it at his hospital. When I asked what the difference would be by going up there. He said Dr Lombardi just advised during my procedure, it was against the law for him to do it here. He said we miss under stood. It cost me a lot of money and time from work. I would have never agreed to this if I had known that Lombardi was not going to do this.

Dr. Taylor seems to have missed type 2 diabetes. My recollection is that I gave a verbal medical history to him and his PA and that tshe failed to appreciate the signifigance of my reports of sweating, jumpiness, nerve pain, etc. They also seem to have failed to appreciate the fact that my business requires intense physical activity; yet, at the time, I was unable to lose weight. Truthfully, Dr. Taylor seems to be a good cardiologist and his female PA seems to be good at seeking out evidence of heart disease, but they both seem to me to have "tunnel vision". I distinctly recall complaining of "hypoglycemia" and sore knees. Since I have been treated correctly for type 2 diabetes, I have lost 55 pounds, my knees don't ache or seem stiff, and I don't feel jumpy or irritable. My health is a big deal to me. I'm not writing that Taylor or his PA are incompetent; I'm stating that they might have listened to me better in the one instance I used their service.

Terrible wait, an hr. and a half, total first visit took 3 hrs., then cashier couldn't operate visa machine correctly (?) Medical staff were fine, even tho lengthy intake procedure with two medical staff before even seeing the dr and retelling presenting concerns for a third time. The office staff was incompetent.

Listens attentively to the patient. Explains precedures and problems. Originally recommended to me by a nurse when I was unhappy with another doctor during an admission. Have never regretted changing. He also has an excellent nursing staff.

William Brown MD Solaris Cardiology. I contacted Dr. William Brown regarding chest pains (Angina) on a Friday afternoon in August 2006. He was insistent that I immediately check into Wellstar Kennestone Hospital I explained the pains were intermittent and had been present for weeks. In addition there was an animal at home & I needed to arrange for his care. I checked into the hospital the following Monday, having no idea that he was personally offended by the delay. During a weeks stay in the hospital, 8 stents were installed. (Yes eight). Dr. Brown allowed no consultation with the anesthesiologist. It was a lengthy procedure, under total anesthesia, that left me unbalanced and unable to walk unassisted to this day. When I later questioned the results in a letter to Brown, it was ignored and he proceeded to ban me from his practice. William Brown should never have been granted a medical license of any kind.

I completely agree with the prior reviewer. Dr. W misdiagnosed my problem. He dismissed my complaints as being in my head even though logically that could not be true. Like the last reviewer experience is that he is an egotist and treated me as if I were stupid and crazy. I left him and went to another Cardiologist at St. Joseph's who performed the barium stress test pushing me to the level where my symptoms appeared and were recorded. He then explained that what I was experiencing was very real and definitely "not in my head".

Too big for his britches. If you see him briefly in the ER you can readily identify the he is a major homophobe. What he doesn't tell you is that he will no longer see you but his PA will coordinate your care. The PA represents himself as an MD ( he no longer works for Piedmont) I wonder why. When I looked online to check the PA's licensure he was no longer licensed as a PA. I followed up with another healthcae provider and had it confirmed that Dr. Whicliff (?sp)completely miss diagnosed my condition. The man is an ass.

Proceed with caution here. I was seen and evaluated by Dr. Wickliffe and his staff for lone atrial fibrillation. I was extremely unimpressed with his staff and his lack of accessibility for questions. Doctor-patient communication was extremely poor in my case. The only way to communicate with him seemed to be either in person (office visit and fee required) or through his clinical assistant, who at the time was not even an R.N. Even her responses were painfully slow - whether via e-mail (with, btw, no evidence of Wickliffe's review or approval) or phone. When he recommended an ablation, needless to say I sought a second opinion. This second specialist advised me that the risks of this procedure in my case clearly outweighed the benefits. I subsequently chose to end my relationship with Piedmont Heart Institute.
Nice guy,

I've seen many docs over the years because of autoimmune issues and he is the worst. Extremely late for my appointment, patronizing attitude, put down other specialists and just plain not interested. What a waste of time.
I heard he beats his wife !!....what a sad personality.
